outputs.output_descr: Using the nationally owned Medium-Term Capacity Development Strategy (MTCDS) as a guiding framework, support the development of public sector reform strategy and implementation of the MTCDS through the establishment of a national coordination framework for public sector development, in particular within the civil service institutions using the Rapid Capacity Development Initiative (RCPI)

The South Sudan public sector is further compromised by problems which delay or disable effective service delivery such as insufficient staff numbers, poor organizational design; ineffective bureaucratic processes; inadequate policy frameworks; lack of equipment; and lack of information systems. The situation at state-level is particularly serious due to the limited expertise in the newly established institution. To overcome these deficiencies and contribute to the Government's State-building efforts, UNDP implements the IGAD Regional Imitative in collaboration with the MoLPS & HRD. The initiative facilitates the recruitment and placement of the Civil Service Support Officers (CSSOs) from Kenya, Ethiopia and Uganda. The CSSOs are expected to transfer skills to  South through coaching, mentoring and backstopping

project_descr: Support the Government to extend its reach and scope of public service delivery particularly at State and County levels; whilst also addressing the policy formulation necessary for establishing, and ensuring the functionality of the civil service.
